DOC.brief_title: Vitamin D Supplementation Cutaneous Malignant Melanoma Outcome
DOC.detailed_description: To assess whether vitamin D supplementation , follow period diagnosis surgery first cutaneous malignant melanoma , protective effect relapse cutaneous malignant melanoma whether protective effect correlate vitamin D level serum vitamin D receptor ( VDR ) immunoreactivity primary tumor .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Older 18 year younger 80 year age . 2 . Histologically proven malignant melanoma , stage one B ( IB ) three ( III ) Not participate clinical trial . 3 . The treatment melanoma surgical treatment . 4 . Complete resection melanoma . 5 . Single primary invasive cutaneous melanoma 6 . Signed ethical committee approve informed consent 7 . Serum phosphate , serum calcium entry study within normal limit laboratory reference Exclusion criterion 1 . Pregnant/lactating woman plan become pregnant study 2 . Known hypersensitivity vitamin D component . 3 . Preexisting renal stone disease , chronic renal disease glomerular filtration rate ( eGFR ) < 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 renal dialysis . 4 . Liver failure chronic liver disease liver enzymes > 2 fold upper limit normal ( ULN ) . 5 . History parathyroid disease granulomatous disease ( TBC sarcoidosis ) 6 . History malabsorption syndrome medical condition might interfere vitamin D absorption . 7 . History small intestine resection . 8 . History malignancy within last 5 year except carcinoma situ cervix basal cell carcinoma squamous cell carcinoma skin situ malignant melanoma . 9 . Chronic alcohol abuse . 10 . Medical logistic problem likely preclude completion study . 11 . Taking medication predisposes hypercalcemia ( digoxin , lithium , thiazide diuretic ) take medication would affect metabolism vitamin D ( anticonvulsant , corticosteroid , H2receptor antagonists ) 12 . Intake vitamin D supplement within 6 month prior entry study .
